body_html:
@negrinho Maybe what I'm saying here is a bit subtle.

Certainly a difference between running in 10 hours and running in 1 hour matters a lot! If your experiments take 10h, you only really get to have one idea a day. That leaves a lot of time to get sad about the problem, and try to fix it :). Turning 10 minute tasks into 1 minute tasks is also very productive.

But turning 10s tasks into 1s tasks? I don't think that's intrinsically useful. It should only matter as evidence of a deeper problem, that would show up on the longer jobs.

I read @soumith 's comment as saying, "Oh, I didn't know people needed the library to scale down to 10s job sizes". My response is, I don't think anyone actually does! I wanted to check that effort wasn't being spent to optimise a micro-benchmark that doesn't matter.
